title: Set favicon and apple-touch icon to the user-uploaded image

requirements.summary: Regenerate the existing favicon and apple-touch-icon assets from the uploaded image (image-3.png) while keeping the exact filenames/paths referenced by frontend/index.html.
acceptanceCriteria: The files /assets/generated/dinigc-favicon.dim_64x64.png and /assets/generated/dinigc-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png are regenerated from image-3.png and included in the frontend build output.
frontend/index.html continues to reference exactly these paths: /assets/generated/dinigc-favicon.dim_64x64.png and /assets/generated/dinigc-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png.
After deployment, the browser tab icon reflects the uploaded image, and adding the site to a mobile home screen uses the updated apple-touch icon.

file_operations.description: Create/replace the favicon asset by regenerating it from the uploaded source image (image-3.png), ensuring the final output is exactly 64x64 and saved at this exact path so it is emitted in the build output.

Create/replace the apple-touch icon asset by regenerating it from the uploaded source image (image-3.png), ensuring the final output is exactly 180x180 and saved at this exact path so it is emitted in the build output.

Verify the favicon and apple-touch-icon <link> references continue to point exactly to /assets/generated/dinigc-favicon.dim_64x64.png and /assets/generated/dinigc-apple-touch-icon.dim_180x180.png (do not change filenames or paths).
